info.title: Operations API
info.description:
Airline API endpoints for server-to-server communication using OAuth 2.0 Client Credentials grant. These endpoints provide access to airline-specific data without user interaction. 

## OAuth 2.0 Client Credentials Flow

1. **Request access token** - Use /oauth/token with client credentials
2. **Make API requests** - Use Bearer token in Authorization header

See the OAuth endpoints documentation below for detailed parameters and examples.

## Token Information
- **Expiry**: 7 days (604800 seconds)
- **Grant Type**: Client Credentials (machine-to-machine)
- **Authentication**: Client ID and secret required

## Security Considerations
- **Protect client secrets** - store securely and never expose in public repositories, logs, or client-side code
- **Secure token storage** - treat access tokens as sensitive credentials with appropriate access controls
- **Use HTTPS only** - all API communications must occur over secure connections
- **Rotate credentials regularly** - implement periodic client secret rotation and revoke unused clients

## Rate Limiting
- Limited to 100 requests per minute per airline
- All OAuth clients for an airline share the same rate limit pool
- Check X-RateLimit-* headers for current limits and remaining requests

## Obtaining Bearer Token
To convert your client credentials to a Bearer token:

**Endpoint**: POST /oauth/token
**Content-Type**: application/x-www-form-urlencoded

**Required Parameters** (form-encoded in request body):
- `grant_type`: Must be "client_credentials"
- `client_id`: Your numeric client ID
- `client_secret`: Your alphanumeric client secret string
- `scope`: Set to "*" for full access

**Response**: JSON object containing:
- `access_token`: The Bearer token to use in Authorization headers
- `token_type`: Will be "Bearer"
- `expires_in`: Token lifetime in seconds (604800 = 7 days)

Use the returned access_token as "Bearer {token}" in the Authorization header for all subsequent API requests

get.description:
Returns a unified list of all activity types with minimal data.
Each activity includes a `detail_url` for retrieving full details from type-specific endpoints.

By default, excludes past activities (where end < now) and CuratedRoster types.
Use `filter[include_past]=true` to include past activities.
Use `filter[type]=CuratedRoster` to explicitly include curated rosters.

parameters.name: Accept
parameters.description: Response format - must be application/json for API responses

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description: Available sorts are `id`, `name`, `type`, `start`, `end`, `show_from`, `order`, `created_at`, `updated_at`. You can sort by multiple options by separating them with a comma. To sort in descending order, use `-` sign in front of the sort, for example: `-id`.

parameters.name: page[size]
parameters.description: The number of results that will be returned per page.

parameters.name: page[cursor]
parameters.description: The cursor to start the pagination from.

parameters.name: filter[type]
parameters.description: Filter by activity type

parameters.name: filter[subtype]
parameters.description: Filter by activity subtype (for Event/Tour)

parameters.name: filter[tag]
parameters.description:
Filter by tag(s)
Returns activities that have ALL of the specified tags
Accepts single tag or comma-separated list

parameters.name: filter[active]
parameters.description: Filter to currently active activities (start <= now <= end)

parameters.name: filter[upcoming]
parameters.description: Filter to upcoming activities (start > now)

parameters.name: filter[visible]
parameters.description: Filter to visible activities (show_from <= now)

parameters.name: filter[registration_required]
parameters.description: Filter by registration requirement

parameters.name: filter[registration_open]
parameters.description:
Filter to activities with open registration window
(registration_start <= now <= registration_end)

parameters.name: filter[include_past]
parameters.description:
Include past activities (where end < now)
By default, past activities are excluded

get.description:
Returns a cursor-paginated list of alerts. Alerts are displayed to pilots on various
pages to communicate important information, system status, or operational notices.
They can be scheduled, set to expire, and prioritized by display order.

parameters.name: Accept
parameters.description: Response format - must be application/json for API responses

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description: Available sorts are `id`, `order_column`, `title`, `type`, `start_showing`, `stop_showing`, `created_at`. You can sort by multiple options by separating them with a comma. To sort in descending order, use `-` sign in front of the sort, for example: `-id`.

parameters.name: page[size]
parameters.description: The number of results that will be returned per page.

parameters.name: page[cursor]
parameters.description: The cursor to start the pagination from.

parameters.name: filter[type]
parameters.description: Filter by alert type

parameters.name: filter[page]
parameters.description: Filter by pages where alert is shown

parameters.name: filter[active]
parameters.description: Filter to show only active alerts (currently showing)

parameters.name: filter[permanent]
parameters.description: Filter to show only permanent alerts (no end date)

path.description: Base path for paginator generated URLs.

per_page.description: Number of items shown per page.

post.description:
Creates a new alert for the airline. Alerts are displayed to pilots on specified
pages (Phoenix dashboard, Pegasus, etc.) to communicate important information.
Alerts can be scheduled to start and stop showing at specific times. Use the
position parameter to control where the alert appears in the display order.

parameters.name: Accept
parameters.description: Response format - must be application/json for API responses

enum: OAuth client does not have a primary airline configured.

get.description:
Returns detailed information about a specific alert including its content,
display settings, and scheduling configuration.

parameters.name: Accept
parameters.description: Response format - must be application/json for API responses

parameters.name: alert_id
parameters.description: The alert to show (resolved via route binding)

put.description:
Performs a partial update on an existing alert. Only fields provided in the request
will be updated - all fields are optional. This follows PATCH semantics where omitted
fields retain their current values. Use the position parameter to change the alert's
display order.

parameters.name: Accept
parameters.description: Response format - must be application/json for API responses

parameters.name: alert_id
parameters.description: The alert to update (resolved via route binding)

delete.description:
Soft deletes an alert. The alert will no longer be displayed to pilots but
can be restored through the admin panel if needed.

parameters.name: Accept
parameters.description: Response format - must be application/json for API responses

parameters.name: alert_id
parameters.description: The alert to delete (resolved via route binding)

get.description:
Returns a cursor-paginated list of flight bookings. This endpoint provides read-only
access to booking data. Use the status parameter to filter between current (active),
past (deleted), and completed (deleted with PIREP) bookings.

Note: Bookings cannot be created or modified through the Operations API. They are
created by pilots through the pilot interface.

parameters.name: Accept
parameters.description: Response format - must be application/json for API responses

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description: Available sorts are `id`, `callsign`, `flight_number`, `created_at`, `deleted_at`, `valid_to`. You can sort by multiple options by separating them with a comma. To sort in descending order, use `-` sign in front of the sort, for example: `-id`.

parameters.name: page[size]
parameters.description: The number of results that will be returned per page.

parameters.name: page[cursor]
parameters.description: The cursor to start the pagination from.

parameters.name: filter[status]
parameters.description:
Filter by booking status.
- current: Active bookings
- past: Deleted bookings without PIREP
- completed: Deleted bookings with PIREP
- all: All bookings regardless of deletion status

parameters.name: filter[pilot_id]
parameters.description: Filter by pilot ID

parameters.name: filter[aircraft_id]
parameters.description: Filter by aircraft ID

parameters.name: filter[fleet_id]
parameters.description: Filter by fleet ID (through aircraft relationship)

parameters.name: filter[departure_id]
parameters.description: Filter by departure airport ID

parameters.name: filter[arrival_id]
parameters.description: Filter by arrival airport ID

parameters.name: filter[network]
parameters.description: Filter by network - the online network for the flight

parameters.name: filter[callsign]
parameters.description: Filter by callsign

parameters.name: filter[flight_number]
parameters.description: Filter by flight number

parameters.name: filter[created_at]
parameters.description:
Filter by creation date with operators (=, >, <, >=, <=)
Use filter[created_at][gte]=2025-01-01 for bookings created on or after date. Supports operators in the value: `>`, `<`, `>=`, `<=`, `<>`, or none (indicating equality). For example: `>value` for greater than `value`, or `value` for equal.

parameters.name: filter[deleted_at]
parameters.description:
Filter by deletion date with operators (=, >, <, >=, <=)
Use filter[deleted_at][gte]=2025-01-01 for bookings deleted on or after date. Supports operators in the value: `>`, `<`, `>=`, `<=`, `<>`, or none (indicating equality). For example: `>value` for greater than `value`, or `value` for equal.

parameters.name: filter[valid_to]
parameters.description:
Filter by validity expiration with operators (=, >, <, >=, <=)
Use filter[valid_to][lte]=2025-01-01T12:00:00 for bookings expiring before or at time. Supports operators in the value: `>`, `<`, `>=`, `<=`, `<>`, or none (indicating equality). For example: `>value` for greater than `value`, or `value` for equal.

path.description: Base path for paginator generated URLs.

per_page.description: Number of items shown per page.

get.description: Returns detailed information about a specific booking.

parameters.name: Accept
parameters.description: Response format - must be application/json for API responses

parameters.name: booking_id
parameters.description: The booking to show (resolved via route binding)

delete.description:
Cancel a booking and all subsequent bookings for the same pilot.

**Important restrictions:**
- Cannot cancel if the booking has position reports created within the last 5 minutes
- Cancels all bookings with ID >= the specified booking ID for the same pilot

parameters.name: Accept
parameters.description: Response format - must be application/json for API responses

parameters.name: booking_id
parameters.description: The booking to cancel

enum: Booking still has recent position reports. Please wait 5 minutes after stopping tracking to cancel the booking.

get.description:
Returns a list of community challenge activities. Community challenges are
team-based competitions where multiple teams compete to reach their targets.
By default, excludes past community challenges (where end < now).

parameters.name: Accept
parameters.description: Response format - must be application/json for API responses

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description: Available sorts are `id`, `name`, `start`, `end`, `show_from`, `order`, `created_at`, `updated_at`. You can sort by multiple options by separating them with a comma. To sort in descending order, use `-` sign in front of the sort, for example: `-id`.

parameters.name: page[size]
parameters.description: The number of results that will be returned per page.

parameters.name: page[cursor]
parameters.description: The cursor to start the pagination from.

parameters.name: filter[tag]
parameters.description: Filter by tag(s)

parameters.name: filter[active]
parameters.description: Filter to currently active community challenges

parameters.name: filter[upcoming]
parameters.description: Filter to upcoming community challenges

parameters.name: filter[include_past]
parameters.description: Include past community challenges

post.description:
Creates a new community challenge activity. Community challenges are team-based
competitions where two teams compete to reach their targets. Each team has its own
count type (passengers, freight, flights, distance, or flight time), target, and
optional filters to determine which PIREPs qualify.

Only one CommunityGoal or CommunityChallenge can be active at a time per airline.

Team filters define which PIREPs qualify for each team:
- airport_groups: departure/arrival airport pairs
- distance_range: min/max distance in nm
- night_takeoff/night_landing: day/night requirements
- landing_rate_range: min/max landing rate FPM
- landing_g_range: min/max G force on landing
- no_violations/max_violations: violation requirements
- fleets: required fleet IDs
- callsign_prefixes: required callsign prefix IDs
- ranks: required pilot rank IDs
- networks: required network types
- route_tags: required route tags
- route_types: required route types

Images must be provided as base64 encoded data (data:image/png;base64,...).

parameters.name: Accept
parameters.description: Response format - must be application/json for API responses

enum: OAuth client does not have a primary airline configured.

get.description:
Returns detailed information about a specific community challenge including
teams with their progress, winner bonus multiplier, and reward configuration.

parameters.name: Accept
parameters.description: Response format - must be application/json for API responses

parameters.name: community_challenge_id
parameters.description: The community challenge to show (resolved via route binding)

put.description:
Updates an existing community challenge. All fields are optional - only provided
fields will be updated. Cannot edit after the challenge has ended.

Changing start/end times, teams structure, or participation_points_per_pirep
will trigger reprocessing of all contributions.

Team progress is preserved when updating - only the configuration changes.

Images must be provided as base64 encoded data. Set to null to remove.

parameters.name: Accept
parameters.description: Response format - must be application/json for API responses

parameters.name: community_challenge_id
parameters.description: The community challenge to update (resolved via route binding)

delete.description:
Permanently deletes a community challenge activity. This action cannot be undone.
Associated participation records and images will also be deleted.

parameters.name: Accept
parameters.description: Response format - must be application/json for API responses

parameters.name: community_challenge_id
parameters.description: The community challenge to delete (resolved via route binding)

post.description:
Creates a new community goal activity. Community goals are collective contribution
targets where all pilots work together toward a shared objective (passengers,
freight, flights, distance, or flight time).

Only one CommunityGoal or CommunityChallenge can be active at a time per airline.

Filters define which PIREPs qualify:
- airport_groups: departure/arrival airport pairs
- distance_range: min/max distance in nm
- night_takeoff/night_landing: day/night requirements
- landing_rate_range: min/max landing rate FPM
- landing_g_range: min/max G force on landing
- no_violations/max_violations: violation requirements
- fleets: required fleet IDs
- callsign_prefixes: required callsign prefix IDs
- ranks: required pilot rank IDs
- networks: required network types
- route_tags: required route tags
- route_types: required route types

Images must be provided as base64 encoded data (data:image/png;base64,...).

parameters.name: Accept
parameters.description: Response format - must be application/json for API responses

enum: OAuth client does not have a primary airline configured.

get.description:
Returns a cursor-paginated list of containers available for cargo operations.
Each container represents a standardized cargo unit (e.g., LD-3, AKE) with specific
size and weight characteristics.

parameters.name: Accept
parameters.description: Response format - must be application/json for API responses

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description: Available sorts are `id`, `name`, `type`, `size`, `weight`, `created_at`, `updated_at`. You can sort by multiple options by separating them with a comma. To sort in descending order, use `-` sign in front of the sort, for example: `-id`.

parameters.name: page[size]
parameters.description: The number of results that will be returned per page.

parameters.name: page[cursor]
parameters.description: The cursor to start the pagination from.

parameters.name: filter[name]
parameters.description: Filter by container name (partial match)

parameters.name: filter[type]
parameters.description: Filter by container type (exact match)

parameters.name: filter[size]
parameters.description:
Filter by size with operators (=, >, <, >=, <=)
Use operators in the filter value (e.g., >2, <=4). Supports operators in the value: `>`, `<`, `>=`, `<=`, `<>`, or none (indicating equality). For example: `>value` for greater than `value`, or `value` for equal.

parameters.name: filter[weight]
parameters.description:
Filter by weight with operators (=, >, <, >=, <=)
Use operators in the filter value (e.g., >1000, <=3000). Supports operators in the value: `>`, `<`, `>=`, `<=`, `<>`, or none (indicating equality). For example: `>value` for greater than `value`, or `value` for equal.

path.description: Base path for paginator generated URLs.

per_page.description: Number of items shown per page.

post.description:
Creates a new cargo container configuration. Define the container type, size, weight,
and any incompatibility relationships with other containers.

parameters.name: Accept
parameters.description: Response format - must be application/json for API responses

enum: Access to the primary airline is not permitted.
OAuth client does not have a primary airline configured.

get.description:
Returns a list of event activities. Events are simple one-off activities
(airport-based or route-based). By default, excludes past events (where end < now).

Uses cursor pagination for optimal performance with large datasets.

parameters.name: Accept
parameters.description: Response format - must be application/json for API responses

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description: Available sorts are `id`, `name`, `start`, `end`, `show_from`, `order`, `created_at`, `updated_at`. You can sort by multiple options by separating them with a comma. To sort in descending order, use `-` sign in front of the sort, for example: `-id`.

parameters.name: page[size]
parameters.description: The number of results that will be returned per page.

parameters.name: page[cursor]
parameters.description: The cursor to start the pagination from.

parameters.name: filter[subtype]
parameters.description: Filter by event subtype

parameters.name: filter[tag]
parameters.description: Filter by tag(s)

parameters.name: filter[active]
parameters.description: Filter to currently active events

parameters.name: filter[upcoming]
parameters.description: Filter to upcoming events

parameters.name: filter[include_past]
parameters.description: Include past events

post.description:
Creates a new event activity. Events can be airport-based (fly from/to specific
airports) or route-based (fly specific routes). Images must be provided as
base64 encoded data (data:image/png;base64,...).

For airport-based events (subtype: "airports"):
- departure_airport_ids: Array of departure airport IDs
- operator: "AND" (must depart AND arrive) or "OR" (depart OR arrive)
- arrival_airport_ids: Array of arrival airport IDs

For route-based events (subtype: "routes"):
- routes: Array of leg objects with departure_airport_id, arrival_airport_id, route_id

parameters.name: Accept
parameters.description: Response format - must be application/json for API responses

enum: OAuth client does not have a primary airline configured.

get.description:
Returns detailed information about a specific event including restrictions
and participation counts.

parameters.name: Accept
parameters.description: Response format - must be application/json for API responses

parameters.name: event_id
parameters.description: The event to show (resolved via route binding)

put.description:
Updates an existing event activity. All fields are optional - only provided
fields will be updated. When changing subtype, all criteria fields for the
new subtype are required. Images must be provided as base64 encoded data.
Set to null to remove an existing image.

parameters.name: Accept
parameters.description: Response format - must be application/json for API responses

parameters.name: event_id
parameters.description: The event to update (resolved via route binding)

delete.description:
Permanently deletes an event activity. This action cannot be undone.
Activity registrations and logbook entries will also be deleted.

parameters.name: Accept
parameters.description: Response format - must be application/json for API responses

parameters.name: event_id
parameters.description: The event to delete (resolved via route binding)

Use this to see what types of aircraft your airline operates and their configurations.
You can filter by code, type, and other attributes.
Weight values default to kg unless weight_unit="lbs" is specified.

parameters.description: Response format - must be application/json for API responses

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description: Available sorts are `id`, `name`, `code`, `type`, `max_pax`, `max_cargo`, `container_units`, `hide_in_phoenix`, `scoring_group_id`, `created_at`, `updated_at`. You can sort by multiple options by separating them with a comma. To sort in descending order, use `-` sign in front of the sort, for example: `-id`.

parameters.description: The number of results that will be returned per page.

parameters.name: page[cursor]
parameters.description: The cursor to start the pagination from.

parameters.description: Filter by fleet name (partial match)

parameters.description: Filter by ICAO aircraft type code (exact match, 4 characters)

parameters.name: filter[type]
parameters.description: Filter by fleet type

parameters.name: filter[hide_in_phoenix]
parameters.description: Filter by hidden in Phoenix status

parameters.name: filter[scoring_group_id]
parameters.description: Filter by scoring group ID

schema.description:
Weight unit for output (defaults to kg)
When set to "lbs", weight values will be converted to pounds

200.description:
Pass weight unit to each FleetData instance



The cursor paginated collection of `FleetData`

Position reports are excluded by default for performance.
Set to true to include the full position history trail

put.description:
Updates the regular points for a PIREP. This replaces ALL existing point entries.
The total points value will be recalculated as the sum of all point entries.

**IMPORTANT**: This endpoint does NOT support partial updates. All existing scores
will be replaced with the provided data. If you need to preserve existing entries,
you must include them in the request.

parameters.name: Accept
parameters.description: Response format - must be application/json for API responses

parameters.name: pirep_id
parameters.description: The PIREP to update points for (resolved via route binding)

put.description:
Updates the bonus points for a PIREP. This replaces ALL existing bonus point entries.
The bonus_sum value will be recalculated as the sum of all bonus point entries.

**IMPORTANT**: This endpoint does NOT support partial updates. All existing bonus_scores
will be replaced with the provided data. This includes system-generated bonuses from
events, activities, and rank bonuses. If you need to preserve existing entries,
you must include them in the request with their type and id fields where applicable.

Bonus entries may include optional 'type' and 'id' fields for tracking their source
(e.g., type: 'event', id: 123 for event-based bonuses).

parameters.name: Accept
parameters.description: Response format - must be application/json for API responses

parameters.name: pirep_id
parameters.description: The PIREP to update bonus points for (resolved via route binding)

post.description:
Triggers a complete reprocessing of the PIREP. This will recalculate all points,
scores, and validations based on the original PIREP data.

**IMPORTANT**:
- This will remove all manual adjustments including landing rate selection and point adjustments
- Claims (type='claim') cannot be reprocessed and will return an error
- The reprocessing happens asynchronously, check back in a few minutes for updated data

parameters.name: Accept
parameters.description: Response format - must be application/json for API responses

parameters.name: pirep_id
parameters.description: The PIREP to reprocess (resolved via route binding)

to flag PIREPs that require additional information or clarification.

**Note**: The need_reply flag can only be set to true when the PIREP status is 'failed'.
However, it can be cleared (set to false) regardless of status.

parameters.description: Response format - must be application/json for API responses

parameters.name: pirep_id
parameters.description: The PIREP to update (resolved via route binding)

enum: Need reply can only be set on failed PIREPs

post.description:
Accepts a PIREP, changing its status to 'accepted' and clearing any need_reply flag.
Returns 204 No Content on success.

**Note**:
- Cannot be used for claims (type='claim'), use accept-claim endpoint instead
- Cannot accept already accepted or complete PIREPs
- Cannot accept if multiple touchdowns exist without landing selection

parameters.name: Accept
parameters.description: Response format - must be application/json for API responses

parameters.name: pirep_id
parameters.description: The PIREP to accept (resolved via route binding)

post.description:

**Note**:
- Can only be used for claims (type='claim')
- Cannot accept already accepted or complete claims
- Awards are added to pilot's statistics

parameters.name: Accept
parameters.description: Response format - must be application/json for API responses

parameters.name: pirep_id
parameters.description: The claim PIREP to accept (resolved via route binding)

post.description:
Rejects a PIREP, changing its status to 'rejected' and clearing any need_reply flag.
Returns 204 No Content on success.

**Note**:
- Cannot be used for claims (type='claim'), use reject-claim endpoint instead
- Cannot reject already rejected PIREPs

parameters.name: Accept
parameters.description: Response format - must be application/json for API responses

parameters.name: pirep_id
parameters.description: The PIREP to reject (resolved via route binding)

post.description:
Rejects a claim PIREP, resetting all points and flight time to zero.
Returns 204 No Content on success.

**Note**:
- Can only be used for claims (type='claim')
- Cannot reject already rejected claims
- Removes all points and flight time

parameters.name: Accept
parameters.description: Response format - must be application/json for API responses

parameters.name: pirep_id
parameters.description: The claim PIREP to reject (resolved via route binding)

post.description:
Invalidates a PIREP, changing its status to 'invalidated' and clearing any need_reply flag.
Invalidated PIREPs are considered void and do not count towards statistics.
Returns 204 No Content on success.

**Note**:
- Cannot be used for claims (type='claim')
- Cannot invalidate already invalidated PIREPs

parameters.name: Accept

parameters.name: pirep_id
parameters.description: The PIREP to invalidate (resolved via route binding)

The credited time will be automatically recalculated based on airline settings:
- If airline includes taxi time: credited_time = block_length - paused_blocks_time
- If airline excludes taxi time: credited_time = flight_length - paused_air_time

parameters.name: Accept

parameters.name: pirep_id
parameters.description: The PIREP to update times for (resolved via route binding)

post.description:
Creates a new roster activity. Rosters are multi-leg activities with aircraft
assignments per leg. Both Roster and CuratedRoster types are supported.

The type determines behavior:
- Roster: Configurable points, award modes (per leg/completion), flexible scoring
- CuratedRoster: No points (always 0), no award modes, simplified tracking

Leg structure:
- departure_airport_id, arrival_airport_id: Required airport IDs
- aircraft_id: Required individual aircraft ID for the leg
- route_id: Optional - if provided, validates route matches airports

For Roster type, legs with route_id store as type='Route', otherwise type='Airport'.
For CuratedRoster type, legs always store as type='Route' regardless of route_id.

Registration is mandatory for both types and auto-sets to activity dates.

Images must be provided as base64 encoded data (data:image/png;base64,...).

parameters.name: Accept
parameters.description: Response format - must be application/json for API responses

post.description:
Creates a new tour activity. Tours are multi-leg activities requiring pilots to
complete legs in sequence. Registration is mandatory for tours.

The subtype determines how legs are defined:
- airports: Legs defined by airport pairs (departure/arrival airport IDs)
- routes: Legs defined by specific routes (departure/arrival airport IDs + route ID)

Legs support staggered visibility via the optional show_from field per leg.

Restrictions can include:
- award_per_leg: Award points for each completed leg
- activity_complete: Award points on full tour completion
- network, fleet, callsign, ranks: Eligibility restrictions
- landing: Landing rate limits (min/max)

Images must be provided as base64 encoded data (data:image/png;base64,...).

parameters.description: Response format - must be application/json for API responses

approved.description: Set to true to approve the livery. Mutually exclusive with rejected and ignored

rejected.description: Set to true to reject the livery. Mutually exclusive with approved and ignored

ignored.description: Set to true to ignore the livery (mark as not needing review). Mutually exclusive with approved and rejected

process_pireps.description:
Whether to process affected PIREPs when changing livery status.
Only applicable when livery is currently pending (not approved, rejected, or ignored).
- When approving: true will accept failed PIREPs
- When rejecting: true will reject or invalidate PIREPs based on airline's autoreject rule configuration
  (requires airline to have an autoreject rule configured for livery failures)
- When ignoring: this parameter has no effect

examples: Reviewed and approved - high quality livery

CommunityGoalFilterAirportGroups.title: Airport Groups Filter
CommunityGoalFilterAirportGroups.description: Filter PIREPs by departure and arrival airport combinations. Multiple groups create OR conditions between groups, while departure/arrival within a group can use AND/OR logic.

operator.description: AND: departure AND arrival must match. OR: departure OR arrival must match.

CommunityGoalFilterDistanceRange.title: Distance Range Filter
CommunityGoalFilterDistanceRange.description: Filter PIREPs by flight distance in nautical miles. At least one of min_nm or max_nm must be specified.

min_nm.description: Minimum flight distance in nautical miles

max_nm.description: Maximum flight distance in nautical miles

CommunityGoalFilterNightTakeoff.title: Night Takeoff Filter
CommunityGoalFilterNightTakeoff.description: Filter PIREPs by takeoff time of day. Set required=true for night takeoffs, required=false for day takeoffs.

required.description: true = require NIGHT takeoff, false = require DAY takeoff

CommunityGoalFilterNightLanding.title: Night Landing Filter
CommunityGoalFilterNightLanding.description: Filter PIREPs by landing time of day. Set required=true for night landings, required=false for day landings.

required.description: true = require NIGHT landing, false = require DAY landing

CommunityGoalFilterLandingRateRange.title: Landing Rate Range Filter
CommunityGoalFilterLandingRateRange.description: Filter PIREPs by landing rate in feet per minute. Negative values indicate descent rate (e.g., -200 FPM is a soft landing, -500 FPM is harder).

min_fpm.description: Minimum landing rate (most negative = hardest acceptable landing)

max_fpm.description: Maximum landing rate (least negative = softest acceptable landing)

CommunityGoalFilterLandingGRange.title: Landing G-Force Range Filter
CommunityGoalFilterLandingGRange.description: Filter PIREPs by G-force experienced on landing. Normal landing is around 1.0-1.5G.

CommunityGoalFilterNoViolations.title: No Violations Filter
CommunityGoalFilterNoViolations.description: Require flights with zero violations. No additional data required.

data.description: No additional data required for this filter

CommunityGoalFilterMaxViolations.title: Max Violations Filter
CommunityGoalFilterMaxViolations.description: Allow flights with up to a maximum number of violations.

CommunityGoalFilterFleets.title: Fleets Filter
CommunityGoalFilterFleets.description: Filter PIREPs by specific fleet types (aircraft types).

tags.description: Array of route tag strings to match
